title: The Hoddle of Coffee : Tottenham Hotspur news and links for Wednesday , May 22
body_text:
good morning !
The Hoddle of Coffee: Tottenham Hotspur news and links for Wednesday, May 22
What else is there to watch?
Tottenham’s 2023-24 season might be over, but there’s still lots of football to watch in the next couple weeks before the international fixtures begin. Let’s take a look at a small selection:
Wednesday, 22 May: Atalanta vs Bayer Leverkusen
Leverkusen went a whole Bundesliga season undefeated. In total, theyv’e not lost for 52 straight games. Can Gian Piero Gasperini’s Atalanta stop them in the Europa League final?
Wednesday, 22 May: Tottenham vs Newcastle
Because apparently no one told ‘em the season was over. This match’ll be over before most of you flick on the hoddle.
Thursday, 23 May: Raith Rovers vs Ross County
Which club will gain promotion to the Scottish premiership? Stay tuned!
Saturday, 25 May: La Liga Week 38
There’s not much going on here. The Champions have been decided, as have the relegated clubs. So why not enjoy watching Las Palmas take on Alaves?
Saturday, 25 May: Man City vs Man United / Celtic vs Rangers / Barcelona Women vs Lyon Women
Okay, Saturday actually seems like a big day. You got an FA Cup final and Manchester Derby rolled up in one (and Erik ten Hag’s final game in Charge of United?), and another derby with the Scottis Cup final featuring Celtic and Rangers. Which is the bigger match?
Neither! That belongs to Barcelona vs Lyon in the Women’s Champions League final.
Sunday, 26 May: Leeds United vs Southampton
The EFL Championship playoff final. Fitzie lives for this, but more on this one later.
Sunday, 26 May: Serie A Week 38
Three clubs are still at risk of relegation: Frosinone, Udinese and Empoli. Who will survive?
As for Cagliari: They’re safe. Manager Claudio Ranieri is set to leave the club after guiding them to survival.
Monday, 27 May: Raith Rovers vs Ross County again
I guess this one is two legs. This is why you should’ve stayed tuned.
Wednesday, 29 May: Olympiacos vs Fiorentina
It’s the Conference League final! Anyone know if Ange is an Olympiacos fan?
Saturday, 1 June: Dortmund vs Real Madrid
The Champions League final we’ve all dreamt of. Former Everton gaffer Carlo Ancelotti is looking to hoist the trophy once more, as is potential Ballon d’Or winner Vinicius Jr.
Fitzie’s track of the day: Paddle To The Stars, by The Dip
And now for your links:
Alasdair Gold chats with Djugarden’s sporting director on negotiating the deal to send Lucas Bergvall to Spurs
The Athletic ($$) debuts a new podcast series, ‘Ange Postecoglou: Made in Melbourne’
Key questions as Scotland NT manager selects squad
Women’s basketball star Angel Reese buys stake in DC womens’ football team
